channel.title: Is it legit to buy a vbulletin copy?
channel.description:
Never got into this, but i was skyping around and i saw this
[img]http://gyazo.com/e9dab56fc0e1de756be4e0378d9e31a8.png?1359843557[/img]
I always wanted to test Vbulletin. But i heard they got tracking methods if you use nulled ones.
Anyways i just asked myself if it was legit to buy a copy and if it would be smart?

item.title: Is it legit to buy a vbulletin copy?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Get an offline webhost and you shouldn’t have a problem with it whatsoever. You are allowed to change the license information from the holder to the second holder ONLY once so in sense, selling them is allowed (but I’m sure they have somewhere in their TOS that you can’t sell the license, but can change the holder’s information to a second person) so either way, it’s a loop-hole.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it legit to buy a vbulletin copy?

item.title: Is it legit to buy a vbulletin copy?
item.dc:creator: @miller4 miller4
item.description:
@miller4 wrote:

That or they’re just selling nulled copies. ^.^ I agree with Ruby, id just go with a nulled version that you get by yourself.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it legit to buy a vbulletin copy?

item.title: Is it legit to buy a vbulletin copy?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

They wouldn’t be selling a certain version, they’d be selling a license key. So it probably wouldn’t be legit, no.

If you want to fool around with it you can used nulled software locally and it’ll run without any issues.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it legit to buy a vbulletin copy?
